title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: When women researchers publish, media attention doesn’t always follow
items.description: Men-led papers receive more media coverage than women’s, new study finds

items.title: First approved drug for mitochondrial disease could pave way for more treatments
items.description: Researchers are testing multiple treatments for the rare genetic conditions

items.title: Cuts in global health and climate hit Research Triangle Institute hard
items.description: “Financial drubbing” underscores reliance of some independent research organizations on federal funding

items.title: Long-lived gamma ray burst could signal a new kind of cosmic catastrophe
items.description: Some theorists think unusual event could be a black hole devouring a star from within

items.title: Journals and publishers crack down on research from open health data sets
items.description: PLOS, Frontiers, and others announce policies trying to stem the tide of suspect research

items.title: Architects of molecular cages win Chemistry Nobel
items.description: Swiss cheese materials called metal-organic frameworks can separate and store gases

items.title: Missing wind from Milky Way’s giant black hole finally found
items.description: Astronomers may have glimpsed a long-predicted wind of gas blowing out from Sagittarius A*

items.title: Well-exercised male mice appear to pass fitness to their male offspring
items.description: Surprising epigenetic effect relies on snippets of RNA packaged within sperm

items.title: Quantum effects in electrical circuits honored with Physics Nobel
items.description: Breakthrough paved the way to many of today’s budding quantum computers

items.title: Big U.S. West Coast earthquakes could come as a one-two punch
items.description: Cascadia and San Andreas fault zones appear to generate synchronized earthquakes
